title: Exploded textiles
text:
What: An exhibition of 29 textile works by 20 artists drawn from the collections of the Art Gallery of New South Wales and Tamworth Regional Gallery.

The artists include Britain's Tracy Emin and Jonathan Monk, and Australians Anita Larkin, Narelle Jubelin and Raquel Ormella.

I do not expect 2002 by Tracey Emin. Tracey Emin

Tracy Emin's I Do Not Expect is an appliqué blanket that subverts the tradition of embroidering homilies with much darker ideas. The work incorporates fabric from her family's clothes and household furnishings.

The unforeseen 1989 by Narelle Jubelin. Narelle Jubelin

Narelle Jubelin's The Unforeseen is a petit point embroidery shaped like an eye. The pupil is an image of a man about to enter a cave, the inside of which is unknown, which gives the work its title. Petit point is created by stitching either in diagonal or horizontal rows across the intersection of threads in the underlying canvas.
description: Works from Australia and overseas stretch the boundaries of traditional fabric crafts.
